translation.en: [woman] Let's start at the beginning.
Once upon a time,
in a freezing world…
Huh. This isn't right. -[record scratching] -Can we start over?
That's better.
You see, our story actually begins here,
translation.it: Vedete, la nostra storia inizia qui,

translation.en: in the Land of Frozen Food…
where ice cream never melts…
translation.it: Dove il gelato non si scioglie mai…

translation.en: and dreams, well, they get frozen, too.
translation.it: e anche i sogni… si congelano.

translation.en: This is Waffles. And her little buddy right there?
translation.it: Lei è Waffles. E il suo amichetto?

translation.en: Well, that's Mochi.
Two best friends with one big dream,
translation.it: Migliori amici con un grande sogno,

translation.en: to become chefs.
But let's just say their cooking was a little on the…
translation.it: Ma diciamo che i loro piatti erano sempre un po'…

translation.en: …cold side.
Ice for breakfast.
Ice for lunch.
Ice for dinner.
But those two, they kept at it.
translation.it: Ma non si sono mai arresi.

translation.en: Know what this could use? -[meeps] -Some shaved ice.
translation.it: Sai cosa ci starebbe bene? Un po' di granita.

translation.en: -Bon appétit! -Bon appétit.
[woman] Until one day, -something appeared outside their window. -Ah!
Our store's truck had gotten stuck in the snow.
translation.it: Il camion del supermercato, bloccato nella neve.

translation.en: Do you think that truck is going somewhere with real, live, fresh food?
translation.it: Credi che quel camion trasporti del cibo vero, vivo e fresco?

translation.en: We've gotta have courage, Mochi, or we'll never learn how to cook.
translation.it: Dobbiamo osare, per imparare a cucinare.

translation.en: You know what? Let's blow this Popsicle stand.
translation.it: Ehi, lasciamo questo posto di ghiaccioli!

translation.en: [woman] And just like that, Waffles and Mochi set off
translation.it: E così, Waffles e Mochi partono per l'avventura più gustosa

translation.en: on the tastiest adventure of their lives.
translation.it: E così, Waffles e Mochi partono per l'avventura più gustosa della loro vita.

translation.en: -[Waffles] Mochi, are we there yet? -[Mochi meeps]
-You ready, Mochi? -[Mochi meeps excitedly]
-Let's go. -[kids] ♪ Freeze! ♪
♪ Listen to your vegetables ♪
♪ And eat your parents With Waffles & Mochi ♪
translation.it: E mangia i genitori Con Waffles e Mochi

translation.en: [kids] Tomato!
-[Waffles] Are we there yet? -[Mochi murmurs]
How about now?
-How about now? -[Mochi] Mmm.
-[Waffles] We're here. -[horn honks]
[Waffles] Mochi, look at all this fresh food.
[Waffles] All this food
is made of food.
Excuse me.
A talking shelf.
A talking… uh…
waffle?
Well, my dad is a frozen waffle. -My mom is a yeti. -[meeps]
translation.it: Papà è un waffle surgelato. Mamma è una yeti.

translation.en: Welcome to the supermarket. I'm Shelfie.
This is my best friend Mochi, I'm Waffles.
translation.it: Waffles e il mio migliore amico, Mochi.

translation.en: Oh, no. I'm so sorry.
It's all right. We'll get this cleaned up.
Hey, Intercommy.
Clean-up on aisle nine.
Oh. All right. That's me. Here we go.
Oh. Wait. Intercommy, Shelfie…
You must be Moppy.
It's just Steve.
Well, nice to meet ya, Steve.
It's crunchy.
This place is so cool. What do you all do here?
translation.it: Che posto fantastico. Cosa fate qui?

translation.en: Huh! That's easy. We work here!
Uh! Can we work here, too?
You'll have to ask our store owner.
She's the one to ask about working here. -Find her upstairs in the garden. -[gasps]
translation.it: Decide lei. La trovi di sopra in giardino.

translation.en: -Upstairs in the garden. -[Mochi murmurs]
Well, hi there.
-Hi. -Who are you two?
-I'm Waffles and this is Mochi. -[murmurs]
Well, hello, Waffles and Mochi. -Hi. -I am Mrs. Obama.
translation.it: Piacere, Waffles e Mochi. Sono la signora Obama.

translation.en: -What can I do for ya? -We wanna work in the supermarket.
translation.it: - Come posso aiutarvi? - Vogliamo lavorare qui.

translation.en: Have you worked in a supermarket before?
-No. -Okay. Have you ever had a job before?
-No? -[Busy] Wait a minute.
Do you even know what a job is?
-No. -Busy, just hold off a second.
-Okay. -[Mrs. Obama] Excuse him.
Why don't we give you a chance?
translation.it: - Vi darò una possibilità. - Ci piacerebbe.

translation.en: -We'd love that. -Let's start with something simple.
translation.it: - Vi darò una possibilità. - Ci piacerebbe. - Qualcosa di facile. - Molto.

translation.en: -Very. -How about that?
-Yeah, that sounds great. -Let's do it.
All right.
You see these?
What a beautiful basket of clown noses.
translation.it: Che bel cesto di nasi da clown.

translation.en: No, these aren't clown noses.
These are tomatoes.
Wait, whose toes?
-[murmurs] -I picked them fresh from the garden.
All you have to do is go downstairs and put them where they belong.
translation.it: Il vostro compito è andare di sotto e metterli a posto.

translation.en: No way they'll be able to do this.
-Can you do that? -No problemo, Mrs. Obama.
-Excellent. Well, get to it. -Yeah.
-We got this, Mochi. -[coos]
-[grunts] Oh, man. -[Mochi meeps]
Jeez, I wish we had something that could move this, like a… like a skateboard or a roller skate or a…
translation.it: Vorrei qualcosa per trasportarli, tipo uno skateboard, un pattino o un…

translation.en: -[Mochi] Wow! -[gasps] …that!
Yeah.
-[gasps] -[Busy] Oh, dear.
Looks like they're gonna take the MagiCart.
Um, hi, magical super shopping cart of our dreams.
Hi.
Hello? We need help.
Where does this tomato belong?
Welcome to MagiCart 3000.
I see you need help finding out where tomatoes belong.
translation.it: Vi serve aiuto per i pomodori!

translation.en: Please put on your safety gear and seat belts.
translation.it: Indossate le protezioni e le cinture.

translation.en: What? We need to do all that? Aren't we just going downstairs?
translation.it: Servono proprio? Dobbiamo andare qua sotto.

translation.en: Well, eventually.
I think we need to gear up.
Three, two, yum!
Blast off!
[Waffles] Listen to your vegetables!
And eat your parents!
-Whoa, buddy. We're flying. -[Mochi laughs]
Where are you taking us?
[MagiCart] Our first stop is Oakland, California,
translation.it: La nostra prima tappa è Oakland, in California,

translation.en: where you'll meet Chef Samin Nosrat from the TV show Salt Fat Acid Heat.
translation.it: dalla chef Samin Nosrat della serie Sale, grassi, acidi, calore.

translation.en: Wow, a chef?
-I'm getting hungry. -[meeps]
Excuse me?
-Hi. -Hi. You surprised me.
-Sorry. -That's okay.
-I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi. -Oh, hi. I'm Samin.
translation.it: - Siamo Waffles e Mochi. - Io sono Samin.

translation.en: -Hey, Samin. -Are you the new neighbor?
-No. We're figuring out where we belong. -[murmurs]
Yeah, good point, Mochi. What we need to figure out is where tomatoes belong.
translation.it: Hai ragione. Dobbiamo capire dove vanno i pomodori.

translation.en: Have you had a tomato before?
-No. -Would you like to taste one of these?
One of my favorite kinds. Cherry tomatoes.
translation.it: Sono fra i miei preferiti, i ciliegini.

translation.en: -Cherry tomatoes? -Yeah.
They're little, like cherries. And they're super sweet.
translation.it: Piccoli, come le ciliegie. E molto dolci.

translation.en: -Here, there's one for you. -Thank you.
-For you, Mochi. -One for Mochi.
-[Wafles gasps] -[Samin] What does that taste like?
It's juicy, and it burst in my mouth.
translation.it: È succoso e mi è esploso in bocca.

translation.en: And it's fresh.
And it's not frozen.
Is this the first time you had a fresh tomato?
-Yes. -Is it blowing your mind?
It really is. I don't know how to process it.
translation.it: Davvero, non so nemmeno come elaborarlo.

translation.en: There are actually 10,000 varieties of tomatoes around the world.
translation.it: Al mondo ci sono 10.000 varietà di pomodori.

translation.en: So, people all over the world cook them in all different ways.
translation.it: E quindi vengono cucinati in tanti modi diversi.

translation.en: -Wow. -You can cook tomatoes?
Yeah. Do you wanna see the other tomatoes I picked?
Oh, yes.
Let's do it. And you know who else is gonna come join us?
translation.it: Andiamo. E sai chi verrà con noi?

translation.en: -Who? -My friend Mia.
[gasps] Hi, Mia. I'm Waffles, and this is Mochi.
translation.it: Ciao, Mia. Siamo Waffles e Mochi.

translation.en: -Come on, Mia. Let's go. -Let's go.
Do you know what a fruit is?
Do I know what a fruit is? Of course I do.
It's a thingamajig that you put on your shelf and admire.
translation.it: È un aggeggio che metti sullo scaffale e ammiri.

translation.en: -You guys don't know? -No.
-I know. -What is it?
It's something that's…
that you can eat.
Yeah, but can't you eat cheese pizza, too?
translation.it: Anche la pizza al formaggio lo è.

translation.en: -Yeah. -Is that a fruit?
-No. -No.
It's something that, when you cut it, the seeds are inside.
translation.it: Se lo tagli, dentro trovi dei semi.

translation.en: You know this?
Yes. It's a green baseball.
-I know what it is. -You--
-It's an apple. -An apple.
I'll cut into it.
-[Waffles] Oh, look, it's got seeds. -[meeps]
Let's try a lemon.
Does it have a seed?
There it is.
I'll squirt some in your mouth. [Samin squeaks]
Not all fruits are sweet.
Do you think there's gonna be seeds on the inside of the tomatoes?
translation.it: Allora, nei pomodori ci sono i semi?

translation.en: Is the tomato a fruit?
[Samin] Do you see all those tiny seeds?
It's got seeds on the inside, Mochi.
[Samin] Yeah.
It means that a tomato's a fruit.
Ah! A tomato is a fruit.
Yeah!
Are you guys ready to make some pasta with tomato candy?
translation.it: Pronti per la pasta coi pomodori essiccati?

translation.en: -Candy? -Everybody's gonna have a job.
Waffles, you're in charge of the cheese.
-I need you to grate it. -All right.
Keep grating, and don't stop until I tell you you're done.
translation.it: Continua finché non ti dico basta.

translation.en: Mia, we're gonna put a bunch of tomatoes in this bowl.
translation.it: Mia, mettiamo i pomodori nella ciotola.

translation.en: -[Mia] Watch out, Mochi. -Grating cheese is like a workout.
-[Mia] Good job, Waffles. -Now, we're gonna put some salt,
translation.it: Brava, Waffles. Ora mettiamo un po' di sale, un po' di zucchero

translation.en: some sugar…
translation.it: Ora mettiamo un po' di sale, un po' di zucchero

translation.en: and some olive oil to help make it stick.
translation.it: e un po' di olio d'oliva.

translation.en: That's gonna make the tomatoes extra delicious.
Running a cheese marathon.
Now, we're gonna put 'em in our oven.
In the meantime, we can get everything else ready.
Sorry, Mochi. I'm resting my arm.
Mia, will you help pick the basil?
All we have to do now is cook the pasta.
I think you did it all.
-I did it? -Yes, you're done!
Amazing.
The pasta might be ready. Should we check?
translation.it: Credo che la pasta sia pronta.

translation.en: Mia, will you help by adding the basil into the bowl?
Now, we can add our last ingredient.
-Tomato. -Tomato candy.
Look at those.
[Samin] Wait till you taste 'em. They taste like candy.
We should put the whole tray in.
-Should I just dump it in? -Dump it all!
-[Waffles laughs] -Know what the finishing touch is?
-[Mia] Cheese! -[Samin] Time to have a bite.
-Don't tomatoes taste like candy? -[Waffles] That is amazing.
I can't believe we just met, and now we're eating together.
translation.it: Ci siamo appena conosciuti e ora mangiamo insieme.

translation.en: That's what cooking and eating together can do.
translation.it: Ecco il potere di cucinare insieme.

translation.en: And now we know where tomatoes belong.
translation.it: E sappiamo dove vanno i pomodori.

translation.en: ♪ I'm not a vegetable ♪
♪ I'm just misunderstood ♪
♪ I've never been a vegetable ♪
♪ And I wouldn't be if I could ♪
♪ Put me in a certain aisle ♪
♪ Like there's no more to discover ♪
♪ But you gotta read my whole book ♪
translation.it: Ma tu leggi tutto il libro

translation.en: ♪ Not just look at the cover ♪
♪ People take one look at me And they think they know who I am ♪
translation.it: La gente dà un'occhiata E poi crede già di sapere chi sei

translation.en: ♪ But I'm here to say Once and for all ♪
translation.it: Ma adesso sai che c'è Ora e per sempre

translation.en: ♪ So that everyone can understand ♪
translation.it: Ve lo dico chiaro e tondo che

translation.en: ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
[vocalizing] ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't define me so fast ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
♪ That, baby ♪
♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't box me in ♪
♪ Unless you're putting me in ♪
♪ A pizza box ♪
♪ It tastes so good ♪
♪ And no matter What kind of tomato you are ♪
translation.it: Non importa quale pomodoro tu sia

translation.en: ♪ Sliced or diced or in a jar ♪
♪ In ketchup or on a salad bar ♪ ♪ Or sun-dried in a primavera ♪
translation.it: Nel ketchup o nell'insalata Seccato al sole in primavera

translation.en: ♪ Tomato ♪
♪ I said, "A tomato" ♪
♪ Is a fruit ♪
[vocalizing] ♪ I'm a fruit ♪
♪ Don't define me so fast ♪
♪ 'Cause I'm here to say, at last ♪
♪ That, baby, I'm a fruit ♪
♪ That's right ♪
[Waffles] Mochi, I can't believe we just ate food that was not frozen.
translation.it: Mochi, abbiamo mangiato cibo non surgelato.

translation.en: Look at those tomatoes, Mochi. Should we go inside?
-[meeps excitedly] -Yeah, for research, obviously.
-Hello. -Oh, hey.
-I'm Katie. -Oh, hi, Katie.
So, we saw a tomato outside. Is this a tomato restaurant? Can we order tomatoes?
translation.it: Da fuori abbiamo visto un pomodoro. Li servono? Possiamo ordinarli?

translation.en: You can order a pizza.
-Oh, pizza! We love frozen pizza. -[meeps]
You have come to the best place to eat pizza.
translation.it: Siete venuti nel posto migliore per assaggiarla.

translation.en: -What? -This is Mozzeria.
-[Waffles] They make pizza here? -They make the best pizza.
translation.it: Fanno la pizza? La pizza migliore di tutte.

translation.en: -Hey, what are you doing with your hands? -I'm talking with my hands,
translation.it: Cosa fai con le mani? Sto parlando con le mani,

translation.en: because everyone who works here is Deaf, and they communicate by using their hands.
translation.it: perché tutte le persone che lavorano qui sono sorde e comunicano così.

translation.en: What does it mean when you're Deaf?
What it means when you're Deaf-- It means you can't hear. You don't use your ears to hear.
translation.it: Vuol dire che non puoi sentire. Non usi le orecchie per sentire.

translation.en: You use your eyes to hear.
So, everyone here uses their hands to talk?
translation.it: Qui tutti usano le mani per parlare?

translation.en: That's right. What's your favorite pizza?
[Katie translates] The Margherita is the most delicious because of the sauce,
translation.it: La Margherita è la più deliziosa grazie alla salsa,

translation.en: and the sauce is pretty much just tomato.
translation.it: che è fatta praticamente solo di pomodoro.

translation.en: I had no idea so much tomato went into pizza.
-[murmurs] -[Waffles] Amazing.
Do you know what I think is the coolest part about this restaurant?
translation.it: Sai qual è la parte più bella?

translation.en: [Waffles] No.
The staff uses their hands to communicate,
translation.it: Lo staff usa le mani per comunicare,

translation.en: but they're also using their hands to make the delicious pizza.
translation.it: ma le usa anche per preparare una pizza deliziosa.

translation.en: Also, the communication and the food are the same.
translation.it: Quindi la comunicazione e il cibo sono la stessa cosa.

translation.en: It's so cool.
-This is Amanda. This is her place. -Hi.
Amanda, how do you sign "pizza"?
-Pizza. -Pizza.
-That was perfect. -Thanks.
-[Katie] Margherita. Here it is. -Pizza.
Here you go, Waffles.
It's all melted together and warm. Mochi, get in on this.
translation.it: È tutto fuso e caldo. Mochi, assaggia.

translation.en: -[Waffles] What did you think, bud? -[Mochi trilling]
Wow, so awesome that tomatoes are fruits. -Huh, Mochi? -Oh.
translation.it: È incredibile che i pomodori siano frutti.

translation.en: As soon as we put tomatoes in the fruit section, we get to stay at the grocery store forever.
translation.it: Mettiamoli nel reparto giusto e resteremo al supermercato.

translation.en: Well, technically, a tomato is a fruit, but chefs use it like it's a vegetable.
translation.it: Beh, tecnicamente sono frutti, ma si cucinano come una verdura.

translation.en: What? Wait, wait, wait. You're saying that a tomato is a vegetable?
translation.it: Che cosa? Aspetta, stai dicendo che sono una verdura?

translation.en: I'm so confused.
Does it belong with the fruits? With vegetables?
translation.it: Vanno con la frutta o con la verdura?

translation.en: [Waffles] Come on. We gotta get out of here. Vegetable fruit.
Oh. Excuse me. Can I take a bite for the road?
Oh, yeah.
[translating from Italian] A tomato is a fruit.
[from Spanish] A vegetable.
[from Japanese] Fruit, because tomatoes are sweet.
[from Italian] Vegetable. It's not sweet enough.
[Spanish] Vegetable.
-[Italian] Vegetable. -[Japanese] Vegetables.
They don't look like fruit.
[Spanish] Vegetable.
[Japanese] I think tomatoes are vegetables.
[Italian] A tomato is a vegetable.
A tomato is a fruit.
Why? Because it has seeds inside.
MagiCart, help. We thought tomato was a fruit, but then we heard it's a vegetable.
translation.it: Aiuto. Pensavamo fossero frutti, ma ci hanno detto che sono verdure.

translation.en: Well, what's a vegetable?
Well, a fruit is the part of a plant with seeds.
translation.it: Un frutto è la parte di una pianta coi semi.

translation.en: Everything else, like the plant's roots, stems, and leaves, are vegetables.
translation.it: Il resto, come radici, gambi e foglie, sono verdura.

translation.en: You're gonna tell us where tomatoes go in the store, right?
translation.it: Quindi ci dirai dove vanno i pomodori?

translation.en: No, but I know just the person to ask.
translation.it: No, ma so a chi chiedere.

translation.en: Let's swing by Washington, D.C., and ask Chef José Andrés.
translation.it: Passiamo da Washington, dallo chef José Andrés.

translation.en: He wrote the book on vegetables. Literally.
translation.it: Ha persino scritto un libro sul tema.

translation.en: Sounds like the perfect person to ask.
Would you expect anything less from me?
translation.it: Vi aspettavate di meno da me?

translation.en: Well, we don't even know you yet, MagiCart. Cool it.
Where are we? Oh, hey. Excuse me.
-Hey. -Are you Chef José Andrés?
translation.it: - Salve. - È lo chef José Andrés?

translation.en: Yes.
Maybe you can help us. We're confused.
translation.it: Forse può aiutarci. Non sappiamo in che reparto vanno i pomodori.

translation.en: We need to put tomatoes away at the store.
translation.it: Non sappiamo in che reparto vanno i pomodori.

translation.en: We learned it was a fruit, then someone told us it was a vegetable.
translation.it: Ci hanno detto che sono un frutto e una verdura.

translation.en: So where does it belong, you know?
translation.it: Ci hanno detto che sono un frutto e una verdura. Dove vanno messi?

translation.en: Well, technically, technically, it's a fruit.
But then, in normal talk, we say it's a vegetable.
translation.it: Ma nei discorsi di tutti i giorni, diciamo che è una verdura.

translation.en: Why? Because we use it in salads.
We use it in savory dishes.
So, you're saying that a tomato can be a fruit and a vegetable?
translation.it: Quindi i pomodori sono sia un frutto che una verdura?

translation.en: Yes. And you will be right in both ways.
translation.it: Sì, è giusto in entrambi i modi.

translation.en: We're gonna make a recipe that I learned from my wife.
translation.it: Ora prepareremo un piatto che mi ha insegnato mia moglie.

translation.en: -Really? -It's called gazpacho.
Gazpacho is from the south of Spain.
It's always hot weather because it's always a beautiful sun in the sky.
translation.it: Là fa sempre caldo perché c'è sempre un bel sole.

translation.en: Oh, so who wants hot soup in a hot-weather place?
-It's a cold soup. -[gasping]
So, we need tomatoes.
Tomatoes go into this blender.
-Cucumber. -Cucumber.
Here. And now, green pepper.
-Garlic. -Garlic.
Garlic in.
This goes in here.
And then, one of my favorite ingredients.
translation.it: E uno dei miei ingredienti preferiti.

translation.en: -What do you think is it? -Is that olive oil?
From olives from the olive tree.
And one more ingredient.
Vinegar.
You wanna honor the tradition of Spain, you put sherry vinegar.
translation.it: Nella tradizione spagnola, si usa l'aceto di Sherry.

translation.en: We put salt.
And one important ingredient.
Love?
Bread.
Oh, bread.
-Wow! That's crunchy. -[bread crunching]
Now, we're gonna blend it.
-Let's blend this. -One, two, three.
Oh, yeah! Oh, yeah!
It's a big party!
It's a gazpacho party!
Oh, yeah!
All right. So, the tomato is ready.
This is what you do. You chop the tomatoes into cubes,
translation.it: Ecco qua. Tagli i pomodori a cubetti e li metti nel piatto.

translation.en: and you put the cubes in the plate.
translation.it: Tagli i pomodori a cubetti e li metti nel piatto.

translation.en: And then, the cucumber.
-The green pepper. -[Mochi] Mmm!
Croutons, cubes of bread.
translation.it: I crostini, dei cubetti di pane.

translation.en: A bit of the olive oil,
and now we need to finish with your favorite new friend.
translation.it: e concludiamo con il vostro nuovo amico.

translation.en: A big cut on the top,
and then you make a cut right there.
And there, the tomato seeds.
The most flavorful part.
And now, you let the party begin.
translation.it: E ora, che la festa abbia inizio.

translation.en: The tomatoes, the green peppers,
-cucumbers, playing with each other. -[Mochi] Uh-huh!
-Do you hear? Can you hear the sound? -[voice vocalizes softly]
[Waffles] I'm listening.
-[faint crackling] -All these sound is that they are happy.
Time to eat.
-[fireworks whistling] -It's really fresh.
Well, we came from the Land of Frozen Foods,
translation.it: Beh, noi siamo venuti qui dalla Terra del Cibo Congelato.

translation.en: where everything was frozen and came here. We didn't know where we belonged.
translation.it: Beh, noi siamo venuti qui dalla Terra del Cibo Congelato. Qual è il nostro posto?

translation.en: So, I think this gazpacho is telling a lot of who I am,
translation.it: Credo che questo gazpacho dica molte cose sul mio conto,

translation.en: and I think it's gonna give you clues to finding who you are, where you're going, because,
translation.it: e vi darà molti indizi per capire chi siete e dove state andando.

translation.en: this gazpacho is from Spain, but then,
translation.it: Viene dalla Spagna, ma molti ingredienti da altre parti del mondo.

translation.en: many ingredients came from other parts of the world.
translation.it: ma molti ingredienti da altre parti del mondo.

translation.en: -And guess what? -What?
I learned that gazpacho can be…
translation.it: Ho imparato che è un piatto che viene…

translation.en: from anywhere.
It belongs everywhere.
It belongs to a place that people gives love to the gazpacho.
translation.it: È di casa dove la gente ama il gazpacho.

translation.en: [Waffles] Yeah.
Hopefully, we can figure out where we belong.
translation.it: Speriamo di capire qual è casa nostra.

translation.en: If we listen to our food, maybe it'll tell us who we are.
translation.it: Ascoltiamo il cibo e forse ci dirà chi siamo.

translation.en: You two ready to put those tomatoes where they belong?
translation.it: Siete pronti a sistemare i pomodori?

translation.en: Yeah. Mochi, we've got a job to do.
translation.it: Sì. Mochi, abbiamo un lavoro da fare.

translation.en: [MagiCart] Now arriving at the supermarket. Good luck.
translation.it: Stiamo arrivando al supermercato. Buona fortuna.

translation.en: All right, Mochi. Wait, you're not Mochi.
translation.it: Bene, Mochi. No, non sei tu.

translation.en: Mochi, we can put these tomatoes away. We know where they belong.
translation.it: Mochi, sistemiamo i pomodori. Sappiamo dove vanno.

translation.en: They're a fruit.
Wait, you think they're a vegetable?
translation.it: Aspetta, pensi che siano una verdura?

translation.en: But Samin said they're a fruit.
translation.it: Samin ha detto che sono un frutto.

translation.en: I mean, sure.
Chef José said people use them like vegetables, but…
translation.it: José ha detto che si usano come verdure.

translation.en: Ugh. I don't know.
Fruit? [pants]
Vegetable?
Fruit?
[echoing] Vegetable?
-Beautiful, huh? -Look at this great spread.
-Thanks for bringing this up. -You're welcome.
-My pleasure. -Delicious.
[Busy] Wanted to spend time with my mentor. See the rosemary spread?
translation.it: Ecco la salsa al rosmarino, per la mia mentore.

translation.en: Wow, and the bakery is really--
Well, well, well.
-Hey, you two. -Well, if it isn't Falafel and Mocha.
translation.it: - Ehilà. - Falafel e Moka in persona.

translation.en: -Waffles and Mochi. -Busy.
Oh, pardon me.
I heard somebody is trying to figure out where tomatoes go.
translation.it: Volevate sapere dove vanno i pomodori.

translation.en: -Mh-hm. -Guess who figured it out?
-Who? -We did.
They belong everywhere.
Well, I guess that is a choice.
Not a good choice, if you ask me.
We put them everywhere because they can go anywhere.
Tomatoes are a fruit because their seeds are inside.
translation.it: Sono un frutto perché hanno i semi,

translation.en: But tomatoes are also a vegetable
because that's how chefs and most people use them.
translation.it: perché in cucina si usano così.

translation.en: Like in pizza or gazpacho.
translation.it: Come nella pizza o nel gazpacho.

translation.en: It's really interesting.
You two showed me a new way to think about tomatoes.
translation.it: Un nuovo modo di pensare ai pomodori.

translation.en: And you see, whenever an employee demonstrates a high level of mastery
translation.it: Se un dipendente dimostra profonde competenze sui nostri prodotti,

translation.en: of our edible inventory, they're awarded a prestigious honor.
translation.it: Se un dipendente dimostra profonde competenze sui nostri prodotti, riceve un'onorificenza.

translation.en: Aren't they, Mrs. Obama?
What Busy is trying to say is that when employees around here
translation.it: Sbuffo intende che se un dipendente fa qualcosa di buono

translation.en: do something good and show an expertise in something, they get a badge.
translation.it: Sbuffo intende che se un dipendente fa qualcosa di buono o è esperto di qualcosa, riceve un distintivo.

translation.en: So, it is my distinct honor
translation.it: Quindi, per me è un onore…

translation.en: to present you with something.
-Wow! -Before I do that,
I want to tell you both how proud I am of you.
translation.it: sappiate che sono orgogliosa di voi.

translation.en: Like the tenacious tomato, you didn't give up on finding where you belong.
translation.it: Come il tenace pomodoro, non vi siete mai arresi.

translation.en: And I can only imagine how you two must have felt, falling into this new world.
translation.it: Chissà cosa avete provato, arrivando in questo nuovo mondo.

translation.en: You worked hard today, and you discovered
translation.it: Ma vi siete impegnati e avete scoperto

translation.en: that you belong, like the tomato, everywhere.
translation.it: che siete a casa ovunque, come il pomodoro.

translation.en: You belong here with us.
This, Mochi and Waffles, is your new home.
translation.it: Questa, Mochi e Waffles, è la vostra nuova casa.

translation.en: And so,
I want to reward you proudly
with the Tomato Badge.
[Waffles] Yeah!
-[Mrs. Obama] In honor of your tenacity -[meeps]
and your courage,
you now belong here with us. You're a part of our family.
translation.it: ora questa è casa vostra. Siete di famiglia.

translation.en: So, where do we put these?
On your official apron, of course.
[robotic voice] Tomato!
Yes! We have a job. We work here now.
translation.it: Sì! Abbiamo un lavoro. Ora lavoriamo qui.

translation.en: -Busy. Join us. -I'll get in on it, too.
